text: ”After the Harvest”, ~1900, National Museum, Warsaw Władysław Szerner (Warsaw, June 3, 1836 - Unterhaching, January 4, 1915) was a Polish painter.http://www.sejm-wielki.pl/b/lu.36833 He studied at the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw from 1862 and from 1865 at the Academy of Fine Arts in Munich.https://matrikel.adbk.de//matrikel/mb_1841-1884/jahr_1865/matrikel-02160 After his studies, he stayed in Munich and worked mainly as a horse painter. With his friend Józef Brandt, he travelled through Volhynia and Ukraine. He was a member of the Kunstverein München (1874-1909). His son, Władysław Karol Szerner (1870—1936), was also a painter; he used to sign as Władysław Szerner Jr. and he often copied painting by his father. ==References== Category:1836 births Category:1915 deaths Category:19th-century Polish painters Category:19th-century male artists Category:20th-century Polish painters Category:20th-century male artists Category:Academy of Fine Arts, Munich alumni Category:Animal painters Category:Polish male painters
